{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Export Desk Officer",
  "description": "Smartwork Outsourcing Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Export Desk Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Export &amp; Sales Administration
Reports To: Export Sales &amp; Business Development Manager

About the Role


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Export Desk Officer to join our growing export division. The successful candidate will play a key role in managing all export operations from order processing and documentation to logistics coordination and customer support.
	This role is crucial to ensuring smooth, compliant, and on-time export shipments of cashew kernels and by-products, while maintaining effective communication with internal teams, customers, regulatory bodies, and logistics partners.


Key Responsibilities
Export Order Management:


	Process confirmed export orders and prepared sales contracts, proforma invoices, and confirmations.
	Coordinate with Production and Quality Control teams to ensure product availability and readiness.
	Track shipment schedules and communicate updates or changes promptly.
	Maintain accurate records of all orders, quotations, and customer correspondence.


Documentation &amp; Compliance:


	Prepare and verify export documentation, including commercial invoices, packing lists, bills of lading, certificates of origin, and phytosanitary certificates.
	Liaise with NEPC, NCS, SON, and NAQS to ensure regulatory compliance.
	Ensure accuracy and completeness of documents submitted to banks, agents, and customers.
	Maintain organized electronic and physical documentation archives.


Logistics Coordination:


	Work with freight forwarders and shipping lines to arrange container bookings and vessel schedules.
	Oversee cargo loading, packaging, labelling, and sealing at the factory.
	Track shipment progress and provide customers with timely updates.
	Monitor logistics costs and maintain freight rate records.


Communication &amp; Reporting:


	Serve as the operational contact point for customers, shipping companies, and inspection agencies.
	Coordinate internally with Finance, Warehouse, and Production teams to ensure export readiness.
	Generate and submit weekly/monthly export activity and shipment status reports.
	Support export incentive documentation (EEG, NEPC, etc.) through accurate record-keeping.


Continuous Improvement &amp; Compliance:


	Maintain 100% compliance with export documentation and banking requirements (LCs, TT, etc.).
	Identify and implement process improvements for documentation speed and accuracy.
	Stay updated on export procedures, trade regulations, and destination-specific requirements.


Expected First-Year Outcomes


	Establish a structured export documentation and tracking system.
	Achieve 100% documentation accuracy and &ge;95% shipment timeliness.
	Support the company&rsquo;s first successful, fully compliant export cycles.
	Maintain a reliable, auditable export records system.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or HND in Business Administration, Logistics, International Trade, or related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of experience in export coordination, documentation, or logistics (preferably in Agro-processing or food exports).
	Certification or training in Export Operations / NEPC Export Procedures is an added advantage.
	Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word) and documentation management tools.
	Excellent attention to detail, communication, and organizational skills.
	Familiarity with cashew or Agro-commodity exports will be an advantage.


Compensation &amp; Benefits


	Salary: Competitive and commensurate with experience.
	Incentive: Performance-based bonus linked to shipment accuracy and timeliness.
	Benefits: Health insurance, communication allowance, and logistics support.


Application Closing Date
15th December, 2025.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;agrofarm828@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Export Desk Officer &ndash; [Your Name]&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Smartwork Outsourcing Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "191778"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Export Desk Officer Job at Smartwork Outsourcing Limited




        
    

        
        Smartwork Outsourcing Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Export Desk Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Export & Sales Administration
Reports To: Export Sales & Business Development Manager

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Export Desk Officer to join our growing export division. The successful candidate will play a key role in managing all export operations from order processing and documentation to logistics coordination and customer support.
	This role is crucial to ensuring smooth, compliant, and on-time export shipments of cashew kernels and by-products, while maintaining effective communication with internal teams, customers, regulatory bodies, and logistics partners.


Key Responsibilities
Export Order Management:


	Process confirmed export orders and prepared sales contracts, proforma invoices, and confirmations.
	Coordinate with Production and Quality Control teams to ensure product availability and readiness.
	Track shipment schedules and communicate updates or changes promptly.
	Maintain accurate records of all orders, quotations, and customer correspondence.


Documentation & Compliance:


	Prepare and verify export documentation, including commercial invoices, packing lists, bills of lading, certificates of origin, and phytosanitary certificates.
	Liaise with NEPC, NCS, SON, and NAQS to ensure regulatory compliance.
	Ensure accuracy and completeness of documents submitted to banks, agents, and customers.
	Maintain organized electronic and physical documentation archives.


Logistics Coordination:


	Work with freight forwarders and shipping lines to arrange container bookings and vessel schedules.
	Oversee cargo loading, packaging, labelling, and sealing at the factory.
	Track shipment progress and provide customers with timely updates.
	Monitor logistics costs and maintain freight rate records.


Communication & Reporting:


	Serve as the operational contact point for customers, shipping companies, and inspection agencies.
	Coordinate internally with Finance, Warehouse, and Production teams to ensure export readiness.
	Generate and submit weekly/monthly export activity and shipment status reports.
	Support export incentive documentation (EEG, NEPC, etc.) through accurate record-keeping.


Continuous Improvement & Compliance:


	Maintain 100% compliance with export documentation and banking requirements (LCs, TT, etc.).
	Identify and implement process improvements for documentation speed and accuracy.
	Stay updated on export procedures, trade regulations, and destination-specific requirements.


Expected First-Year Outcomes


	Establish a structured export documentation and tracking system.
	Achieve 100% documentation accuracy and ≥95% shipment timeliness.
	Support the company’s first successful, fully compliant export cycles.
	Maintain a reliable, auditable export records system.


Qualifications & Experience


	Bachelor’s degree or HND in Business Administration, Logistics, International Trade, or related field.
	2–4 years of experience in export coordination, documentation, or logistics (preferably in Agro-processing or food exports).
	Certification or training in Export Operations / NEPC Export Procedures is an added advantage.
	Proficient in MS Office (Excel, Word) and documentation management tools.
	Excellent attention to detail, communication, and organizational skills.
	Familiarity with cashew or Agro-commodity exports will be an advantage.


Compensation & Benefits


	Salary: Competitive and commensurate with experience.
	Incentive: Performance-based bonus linked to shipment accuracy and timeliness.
	Benefits: Health insurance, communication allowance, and logistics support.


Application Closing Date
15th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: agrofarm828@gmail.com using “Export Desk Officer – [Your Name]” as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Support Officer",
  "description": "Catilas Resources Limited is an outsourcing and advisory services Company. Our focus is to help our clients leverage their core capabilities to optimize market opportunities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Responsible for providing technical assistance, troubleshooting, and support to staff, ensuring the smooth functioning of all IT systems, hardware, and software within the organization.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide first-line technical support for hardware, software, and network issues.
	Install, configure, and maintain computer systems, applications, and peripherals.
	Monitor system performance and ensure adherence to IT security standards.
	Assist with routine system backups, updates, and documentation.
	Support the setup of new users, including account creation and system access.


Requirements


	OND in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Basic knowledge of computer hardware, software, and networking.
	Strong troubleshooting and communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and within a team.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hrbp@catilas.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

IT Support Officer Job at Catilas Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Catilas Resources Limited is an outsourcing and advisory services Company. Our focus is to help our clients leverage their core capabilities to optimize market opportunities.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT Support Officer

Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Responsible for providing technical assistance, troubleshooting, and support to staff, ensuring the smooth functioning of all IT systems, hardware, and software within the organization.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Provide first-line technical support for hardware, software, and network issues.
	Install, configure, and maintain computer systems, applications, and peripherals.
	Monitor system performance and ensure adherence to IT security standards.
	Assist with routine system backups, updates, and documentation.
	Support the setup of new users, including account creation and system access.


Requirements


	OND in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
	Basic knowledge of computer hardware, software, and networking.
	Strong troubleshooting and communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and within a team.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hrbp@catilas.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Smartwork Outsourcing Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Island, Lagos&nbsp;(with field assignments across Nigeria)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Oil &amp; Gas / Energy / Engineering Services

Job Summary


	The Business Development Specialist will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, managing client relationships, and driving revenue growth within Nigeria&rsquo;s oil and gas value chain.
	The ideal candidate must possess a strong technical understanding of the industry, excellent networking ability, and a proven track record of closing deals in oilfield or energy-related services.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and secure new business opportunities across upstream, midstream, and downstream operations.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, contractors, and regulatory bodies.
	Lead proposal and tender development processes &mdash; from bid preparation to presentation.
	Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitors, and partnership opportunities.
	Collaborate with internal technical teams to align business proposals with service delivery capabilities.
	Prepare regular business performance reports and forecasts for management review.
	Represent company at trade shows, exhibitions, and industry networking events.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Engineering, Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	5&ndash;7 years of proven experience in business development, marketing, or commercial roles in the Oil &amp; Gas industry.
	Demonstrable understanding of oilfield services, project bidding, and client acquisition in the energy sector.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
	Strong analytical and market intelligence abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
	Willingness to travel within and outside Nigeria as business demands.


Core Competencies:


	Business networking and stakeholder management
	Proposal and tender writing
	Strategic sales planning and execution
	Client relationship management
	Commercial and contract negotiation
	Excellent reporting and documentation skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team in a growing energy company.
	Exposure to large-scale oil and gas projects and strategic partnerships.
	Continuous professional development and career advancement opportunities.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to:&nbsp;agrofarm828@gmail.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application - Business Development Specialist &ndash; Oil &amp; Gas&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",

Business Development Specialist Job at Smartwork Outsourcing Limited




        
    

        
        Smartwork Outsourcing Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Specialist

Job Location: Island, Lagos (with field assignments across Nigeria)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Oil & Gas / Energy / Engineering Services

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Business Development Specialist will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, managing client relationships, and driving revenue growth within Nigeria’s oil and gas value chain.
	The ideal candidate must possess a strong technical understanding of the industry, excellent networking ability, and a proven track record of closing deals in oilfield or energy-related services.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and secure new business opportunities across upstream, midstream, and downstream operations.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, contractors, and regulatory bodies.
	Lead proposal and tender development processes — from bid preparation to presentation.
	Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitors, and partnership opportunities.
	Collaborate with internal technical teams to align business proposals with service delivery capabilities.
	Prepare regular business performance reports and forecasts for management review.
	Represent company at trade shows, exhibitions, and industry networking events.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Engineering, Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	5–7 years of proven experience in business development, marketing, or commercial roles in the Oil & Gas industry.
	Demonstrable understanding of oilfield services, project bidding, and client acquisition in the energy sector.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
	Strong analytical and market intelligence abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
	Willingness to travel within and outside Nigeria as business demands.


Core Competencies:


	Business networking and stakeholder management
	Proposal and tender writing
	Strategic sales planning and execution
	Client relationship management
	Commercial and contract negotiation
	Excellent reporting and documentation skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team in a growing energy company.
	Exposure to large-scale oil and gas projects and strategic partnerships.
	Continuous professional development and career advancement opportunities.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: agrofarm828@gmail.com using “Application - Business Development Specialist – Oil & Gas” as the subject of the mail.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Secretary",
  "description": "Catilas Resources Limited - Our client is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Secretary

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	We are recruiting for the position of Executive Secretary on behalf of our client.
	We are looking for a dynamic, self-motivated person who has the capability, energy, and drive to deliver on its mandate.
	The candidate shall have the maturity, experience, and attitude necessary to provide excellent leadership.
	Our client is keen to fill the position with an individual who has excellent people skills, a track record, and proven institutional development testimony.
	The successful candidate will also have strong administrative and digital skills with computer systems proficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	The Executive Secretary is to provide leadership and coordinate all activities of the client in accordance with its enabling Law, Regulations and Rules, and its Strategic Plan, as well as implementing decisions of the Executive Committee.
	Enhance the client&rsquo;s advocacy role and stakeholder engagement across regulators, law enforcement agencies, and financial institutions, and all tiers of the economy.
	Oversee the development and widespread dissemination of regulations for the practice of the profession, and the enforcement of the licensing regime.
	Drive execution of the client&rsquo;s strategic and operational plans, and direct daily administrative tasks of the Secretariat to achieve the client&rsquo;s goals.
	Ensure implementation of all policies, plans, and decisions of the EXCO, various committees, and CCOs.
	The Executive Secretary is directly responsible to the EXCO for the day-to-day management of the affairs of the client.
	Similarly, the Executive Secretary will work closely with the Sub-Committee of the EXCO from time to time to deliver on EXCO&rsquo;s mandate.
	The Executive Secretary is also the Secretary to the client&rsquo;s EXCO.
	The Executive Secretary is to lead the overall growth and development of the establishment, which involves key activities such as:
	
		Digitization of Operations
		Strategy Development, Planning, and Reporting
		Relationship Management
		Operational Management
		Compliance with statutory requirements with a clear understanding of Regulatory, Government, and Industry Processes.
	
	


Requirements
The candidate for the post of Executive Secretary is required to possess:


	A minimum of Bachelor&#39;s degree from a reputable university. A master&rsquo;s degree in any of the Social Sciences, including Law, Accounting, Economics, etc., or relevant disciplines from a recognized university will be an added advantage.
	Evidence of current membership of a reputable professional institute for at least 3 years.
	The individual must have a minimum of 8 years&rsquo; cognate working experience in administrative, general, or operational management roles with demonstrable capability in engaging diverse stakeholders, leading teams, and delivering results.
	A high integrity and moral character with excellent interpersonal relations.
	Demonstrable evidence of consummate management and leadership drive in previous positions; in addition, must possess excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and bookkeeping.
	A considerable degree of competence, responsiveness, and judgement on management matters with outstanding experience at the top management level.
	A capacity to instil confidence in others and command the loyalty and respect of people.
	A capacity to understand the complexity of the professional system and must be able to effectively utilize human resources to attain a world-class status.
	Must be ICT compliant in Microsoft Suite, Use of Meeting tools, e.g., Zoom, Teams, etc.


Benefits


	The client offers an attractive and competitive package in accordance with its conditions of service to the successful candidate.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-13",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Catilas Resources Limited"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

Executive Secretary Job at Catilas Resources Limited




        
    

        
        Catilas Resources Limited - Our client is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Secretary

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are recruiting for the position of Executive Secretary on behalf of our client.
	We are looking for a dynamic, self-motivated person who has the capability, energy, and drive to deliver on its mandate.
	The candidate shall have the maturity, experience, and attitude necessary to provide excellent leadership.
	Our client is keen to fill the position with an individual who has excellent people skills, a track record, and proven institutional development testimony.
	The successful candidate will also have strong administrative and digital skills with computer systems proficiency.


Key Responsibilities


	The Executive Secretary is to provide leadership and coordinate all activities of the client in accordance with its enabling Law, Regulations and Rules, and its Strategic Plan, as well as implementing decisions of the Executive Committee.
	Enhance the client’s advocacy role and stakeholder engagement across regulators, law enforcement agencies, and financial institutions, and all tiers of the economy.
	Oversee the development and widespread dissemination of regulations for the practice of the profession, and the enforcement of the licensing regime.
	Drive execution of the client’s strategic and operational plans, and direct daily administrative tasks of the Secretariat to achieve the client’s goals.
	Ensure implementation of all policies, plans, and decisions of the EXCO, various committees, and CCOs.
	The Executive Secretary is directly responsible to the EXCO for the day-to-day management of the affairs of the client.
	Similarly, the Executive Secretary will work closely with the Sub-Committee of the EXCO from time to time to deliver on EXCO’s mandate.
	The Executive Secretary is also the Secretary to the client’s EXCO.
	The Executive Secretary is to lead the overall growth and development of the establishment, which involves key activities such as:
	
		Digitization of Operations
		Strategy Development, Planning, and Reporting
		Relationship Management
		Operational Management
		Compliance with statutory requirements with a clear understanding of Regulatory, Government, and Industry Processes.
	
	


Requirements
The candidate for the post of Executive Secretary is required to possess:


	A minimum of Bachelor's degree from a reputable university. A master’s degree in any of the Social Sciences, including Law, Accounting, Economics, etc., or relevant disciplines from a recognized university will be an added advantage.
	Evidence of current membership of a reputable professional institute for at least 3 years.
	The individual must have a minimum of 8 years’ cognate working experience in administrative, general, or operational management roles with demonstrable capability in engaging diverse stakeholders, leading teams, and delivering results.
	A high integrity and moral character with excellent interpersonal relations.
	Demonstrable evidence of consummate management and leadership drive in previous positions; in addition, must possess excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and bookkeeping.
	A considerable degree of competence, responsiveness, and judgement on management matters with outstanding experience at the top management level.
	A capacity to instil confidence in others and command the loyalty and respect of people.
	A capacity to understand the complexity of the professional system and must be able to effectively utilize human resources to attain a world-class status.
	Must be ICT compliant in Microsoft Suite, Use of Meeting tools, e.g., Zoom, Teams, etc.


Benefits


	The client offers an attractive and competitive package in accordance with its conditions of service to the successful candidate.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Assistant",
  "description": "The Place - We are a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria).&nbsp;We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos

Job Description


	Source for the most reliable suppliers for items at a reasonable price and ensure supply in good time.
	Coordinate the central supply of items.
	Follow up with account on vendor payment and escalate in peculiar cases.
	Carry out Market survey of products.
	Communicate prices of items to outlet in good time.
	Proper vendor management.


Qualifications


	An OND qualification or equivalent.
	Solid knowledge and understanding of procurement processes, policy, and systems.
	No experience is needed.
	Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel).
	Ability to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions.
	Ability to negotiate, establish, and administer contracts.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently.
	Accurate and precise attention to detail.
	Ability to work well with management and staff at all levels.
	Goal-oriented, organized team player.


Note:&nbsp;Candidates who do not meet the above criteria need not apply.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-13",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-19",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "The Place - Smackers Limited"
    
  },

Procurement Assistant Job at the Place - Smackers Limited




        
    

        
        The Place - We are a fast growing, world class, and dynamic, multi-billion Nigerian conglomerates, established and managed by a team of professionals with decades of management consulting and accounting experience/ training from Arthur Andersen (now KPMG in Nigeria). We are a profitable player in the QSR sector of the Hospitality industry in Nigeria with great prospects and staff strength of over 1000 employees. Currently, our operations span across 17 locations in Lagos and Abuja, Nigeria, with rapid expansion plans to penetrate more locations in the short to medium term.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Description


	Source for the most reliable suppliers for items at a reasonable price and ensure supply in good time.
	Coordinate the central supply of items.
	Follow up with account on vendor payment and escalate in peculiar cases.
	Carry out Market survey of products.
	Communicate prices of items to outlet in good time.
	Proper vendor management.


Qualifications


	An OND qualification or equivalent.
	Solid knowledge and understanding of procurement processes, policy, and systems.
	No experience is needed.
	Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel).
	Ability to analyze problems and strategize for better solutions.
	Ability to negotiate, establish, and administer contracts.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently.
	Accurate and precise attention to detail.
	Ability to work well with management and staff at all levels.
	Goal-oriented, organized team player.


Note: Candidates who do not meet the above criteria need not apply.    

    

        Click here to Apply
